summary: This code is a shell script for Linux. It executes an unloadram_fs.sh file, creates a directory called "fs", sets the necessary permissions using sudo chmod 777, and mounts a tmpfs filesystem named myramdisk_fs with a size of 10m to the directory "fs". This process involves loading RAM disk into memory.

details.comment: This code is a shell script for Linux. It executes an unloadram_fs.sh file, creates a directory called "fs", sets the necessary permissions using sudo chmod 777, and mounts a tmpfs filesystem named myramdisk_fs with a size of 10m to the directory "fs". This process involves loading RAM disk into memory.
details.content:
#!/bin/bash
./unloadram_fs.sh
#sudo mkdir ramdisk
sudo mkdir fs
sudo chmod 777 fs
sudo mount -t tmpfs -o size=10m myramdisk_fs fs
